title: MainIbem
author: MainIbem
content: Good morning my lovely people I say make i bring small update come board small I no know weda una don get the information wey federal government dey talk say all commercial banks go shut down for 24hrs in celebration of 63th year anniversary of our 9ja comes on October 1. But the shutting down go dey effect on Monday 2 October.Now my concern be say, our independence fall on Sunday why federal government want stress people with their issues and even though say every body I mean, all sectors go obey the independence why them wan include banks how business people go do am. I no know why this our new bubu wey enter sit wan make him own things dey different.Abeg wetin una fit yan for this matter e go or e no good?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: When I saw the news yesterday, the title is misleading and it misled people like you. October 1 is a public holiday before Tinubu become a president. If a holiday is during weekend, it would be shifted to Monday. If you can call the president bubu, what should we call you for bringing this kind of useless topic?

comments.author: iBaba

I no know why this our new bubu wey enter sit wan make him own things dey different.Abeg wetin una fit yan for this matter e go or e no good?I no really see this news as anything sha. Not anything negative. I know everybody get him own opinion when it comes to things like this and everyone go want make him/her opinion carry weight. But thing be say, i no really see wetin dey wrong for this matter, since na human beings (Nigerians) too like you dey work for those banks and dem too need rest, and enjoy the rare joy and reverence wey such event they bring once in every year.October 1st na the day wey Nigerian collect freedom on top white people wey come colonize us move our properties dem, legally and illegally go their own country to go develop themselves con leave us inside the mess wey we dey today. At least, Nigerian people, our leaders of then, who are the very true-spirited leaders wey we get dem, stand up against those oppression con help us collect our independence, diplomatically.I believe say October 1st na one event way every brethren and progressive Nigerian go dey happy about. Hence the cause for the public holiday. So, I personally no see anything wrong with them closing for just 1 day. No forget say, even as them close, them ATM booths still dey open to collect cash.Thank Almighty say we also get access to cashless society where you fit do virtually everything for your phone and POS, if you are left with no other option – in worst case scenario. So for somebody like me, I no really see any problem inside so far as dem go leave cash inside their ATM machines for that day.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: I don't see any special effect that this has on the people. We have been having national holidays every now and then. The last few days being Wednesday, there was a holiday, and the banking system was not excluded. In celebration of Nigeria's independence, we don't expect some sectors to enjoy the freedom, and some are working their asses out. This should just be seen as any other holiday we have in a while, and the reason for the holdiday being reasonable enough is not as if one cannot make use of their mobile banking; the only thing that's affected is that the banking sectors won't be open that very day, and it's not just the banks; some official workers who are government employees won't also be in office that day. It's just a day to enjoy and spread the freedom they believe we achieved 64 years ago. Let's just consider it a little free time given to workers to enjoy their time with their family and friends at home and enjoy the air and space of freedom.

I no know why this our new bubu wey enter sit wan make him own things dey different.Abeg wetin una fit yan for this matter e go or e no good?I know see anything wrong with federal government decisions on shutting down banks for 24 hours even though the independence didn't fall on the said date but whichever way it is this is our country, it's just unfortunate that we work almost all day in this country no time to rest at all. Me self I even suggest that apart from dates that are fixed for public holidays , Nigeria as a country needs to set aside some days for workers to rest just like some other western countries does.Moreover, shutting down banks for 24 hours shouldn't bother us as so many medium of monetary transactions have been made available for us online. So it shouldn't be an issue to us at all my people

comments.author: AYOBA
comments.body: Quote from: MainIbem on September 30, 2023, 06:08:06 AMNow my concern be say, our independence fall on Sunday why federal government want stress people with their issues and even though say every body I mean, all sectors go obey the independence why them wan include banks how business people go do am. I no know why this our new bubu wey enter sit wan make him own things dey different.Abeg wetin una fit yan for this matter e go or e no good?I don't see any problem with the government declaring a public holiday for the country, as the bank shutdown is only 24 hours old. I don't think it will have an impact with the businesspeople. To be honest, we shouldn't criticize the federal government because this public holiday has been observed every year on October 1st since before Baba Tinubu was not elected, thus I don't see anything wrong with it.Everyone deserves to celebrate the 63th anniversary of our nation because we can all agree that we are proud of it, just as we do when it is our birthday. What will prevent you from celebrating your fatherland's freedom independence when you can celebrate your birthday?

comments.author: rachael9385
comments.body: From my secondary school days till date, I have known that once a public holiday falls on Saturday or Sunday, that means on Monday there will be no school because it's a holiday. It's both schools, banks and government workers won’t go to work, so it is not a bad idea for a bank to shut down for 24 hrs because it's a holiday. Besides, if banks don't open on Sundays and Saturday, businessmen and women who are in business are still doing well. It is just for everyone to plan ahead, so they won't be affected when it happens.Moreover, we have POS shops almost everywhere around us, so even if banks close for a whole 48 hrs it won't affect them because people will start making use of the POS more, but as long as bank ATMs are working 24 hrs, shut down will not be a problem for business people.

This nah the reason why we dey advocate for BTC and why the Govt no dey in strong support because them know say them no get hands for there. I no mean to look unpatriotic o but I no feel say naija sopoz dey get holidays for days like this sef. I no see wetin we dey celebrate if you ask me. Well, Tinubu don give order nah, who are the poor masses to object?
